title: Harold

|   | A middle-aged bounty hunter, anxious to retire after one final job. He hopes to settle down somewhere and live a quiet life with his family, using the money from his final bounty: you. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Harold the Weathered** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") human bounty hunter who generates with several [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net"), a decent weapon, and moderately heavy [armour](/Armour "Armour"). He has high HP and some strong spells which severely limit your ability to escape, but he has no resistances and is only about as strong as an [orc knight](/Orc_knight "Orc knight") in melee.

## Location

- [The Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"):7-11
- The [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"):1
- [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair"):1-2

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                         |                                                     |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Harpoon Shot](/Harpoon_Shot "Harpoon Shot") (2d12)     | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Sentinel's Mark](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- The spell [Harpoon Shot](/Harpoon_Shot "Harpoon Shot") coupled with his [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net") can make it extremely difficult to escape Harold, as he will repeatedly pull you towards him and trap you there whilst pummeling you with his competent melee skills.
- Watch out for his [Sentinel's Mark](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark"), which will often have an extremely high success rate (about 80%) unless you've found [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower")-enhancing equipment. If he tags you with it, you'll have enemies from all over the entire floor showing up while Harold keeps you pinned down. As a result, it may be best to fight Harold on a cleared floor where there will be no enemies for him to attract.
  - If you run into Harold and aren't ready to fight him, consider escaping to a different floor and coming back through a different staircase to avoid him. Having a good [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") score makes this easier as you might escape his notice, but even heavily armored brutes can generally manage to get away as long as he stays right at the edge of your line of sight.
- Harold can't see invisible, so feel free to quaff a potion and then hack away. Any other methods of buffing yourself (such as [might](/Might "Might"), [haste](/Haste "Haste"), [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk"), etc.) work as well.

## History

- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), Harold generated later (D:10-12, Lair:1-4 and Orc:1), had worse armour and weapons, and had the spells [Bolt of Fire](/Bolt_of_Fire "Bolt of Fire") and [Blink](/Blink "Blink") instead of [Harpoon Shot](/Harpoon_Shot "Harpoon Shot") and [Sentinel's Mark](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark").

Harold

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Harold @ 
HP 50-102
HD 9
XP 994
Speed 10
AC 0
EV 8
Will 60
Attack1 20 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type human, human
Flags Fighter
Speaks
Warm-blooded
Unique
Male
A middle-aged bounty hunter, anxious to retire after one final job. He hopes to settle down somewhere and live a quiet life with his family, using the money from his final bounty: you.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Harold the Weathered is a unique human bounty hunter who generates with several throwing nets, a decent weapon, and moderately heavy armour. He has high HP and some strong spells which severely limit your ability to escape, but he has no resistances and is only about as strong as an orc knight in melee.

Location

  • The Dungeon:7-11
  • The Orcish Mines:1
  • The Lair:1-2

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Harpoon Shot (2d12) Wizard flag
Slot2 Sentinel's Mark Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • The spell Harpoon Shot coupled with his throwing nets can make it extremely difficult to escape Harold, as he will repeatedly pull you towards him and trap you there whilst pummeling you with his competent melee skills.
  • Watch out for his Sentinel's Mark, which will often have an extremely high success rate (about 80%) unless you've found willpower-enhancing equipment. If he tags you with it, you'll have enemies from all over the entire floor showing up while Harold keeps you pinned down. As a result, it may be best to fight Harold on a cleared floor where there will be no enemies for him to attract.
    • If you run into Harold and aren't ready to fight him, consider escaping to a different floor and coming back through a different staircase to avoid him. Having a good Stealth score makes this easier as you might escape his notice, but even heavily armored brutes can generally manage to get away as long as he stays right at the edge of your line of sight.
  • Harold can't see invisible, so feel free to quaff a potion and then hack away. Any other methods of buffing yourself (such as might, haste, berserk, etc.) work as well.

History

  • Prior to 0.22, Harold generated later (D:10-12, Lair:1-4 and Orc:1), had worse armour and weapons, and had the spells Bolt of Fire and Blink instead of Harpoon Shot and Sentinel's Mark.

{{version026}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Harold the Weathered''' is a [[unique]] human bounty hunter who generates with several [[throwing net]]s, a decent weapon, and moderately heavy [[armour]]. He has high HP and some strong spells which severely limit your ability to escape, but he has no resistances and is only about as strong as an [[orc knight]] in melee.

==Location==
*[[The Dungeon]]:7-11
*The [[Orcish Mines]]:1
*[[The Lair]]:1-2

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*The spell [[Harpoon Shot]] coupled with his [[throwing net]]s can make it extremely difficult to escape Harold, as he will repeatedly pull you towards him and trap you there whilst pummeling you with his competent melee skills.
*Watch out for his [[Sentinel's Mark]], which will often have an extremely high success rate (about 80%) unless you've found [[willpower]]-enhancing equipment. If he tags you with it, you'll have enemies from all over the entire floor showing up while Harold keeps you pinned down. As a result, it may be best to fight Harold on a cleared floor where there will be no enemies for him to attract.
**If you run into Harold and aren't ready to fight him, consider escaping to a different floor and coming back through a different staircase to avoid him. Having a good [[Stealth]] score makes this easier as you might escape his notice, but even heavily armored brutes can generally manage to get away as long as he stays right at the edge of your line of sight.
*Harold can't see invisible, so feel free to quaff a potion and then hack away. Any other methods of buffing yourself (such as [[might]], [[haste]], [[berserk]], etc.) work as well.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.22]], Harold generated later (D:10-12, Lair:1-4 and Orc:1), had worse armour and weapons, and had the spells [[Bolt of Fire]] and [[Blink]] instead of [[Harpoon Shot]] and [[Sentinel's Mark]].
